page.title: 02Farming Around Himbleton (1)
page.content: This is a very mixed area for farming , ranging from highly intensive systems to extensive ones. Most of the land is overlying a clay subsoil , with a limestone ridge running right across the area. Within the area there are a number of acres of woodland. These are a mixture of Oak , Birch and Beech harbouring a variety of wildlife. The extensive farming consists of the feeding and rearing of sheep and beef animals on grass , many of the meadows used have been permanently in grass for centuries , especially those which run close to brooks. Both lambs and beef are fattened on the grass ready for consumption.
